Palm Beach Square Scarf.productDescription: Sewing New Futures presents our Summer Essentials Collection. Our Palm Beach Square Scarf Scarf is handcrafted with Ikat fabric and sewn together by our artisans with intricate embellishments.  Our women workers represent ‘backwards caste’ communities that have traditionally engaged in prostitution. Starting from around 14 years old, adolescent girls are married off and forcibly engaged in prostitution by their in-laws. Sewing New Futures is an alternative livelihood generation scheme so poor adolescent girls and women can break this vicious cycle of intergenerational prostitution. 100% of the profits directly help break the cycle of intergenerational prostitution.

Diamond Ikat Bifold Wallet in Grey.productName: Diamond Ikat Bifold Wallet in Grey
Diamond Ikat Bifold Wallet in Grey.productDescription: In 2009, Nomi began working with a local social enterprise and training center in Phnom Penh whose mission is to provide vocational training and transitional jobs for survivors and women at risk of sex trafficking. Through our partnership, Nomi designed and developed a product line that is made by survivors, which Nomi markets globally. The women receive competitive wages and medical care. All proceeds from Nomi’s product sales are invested in improving benefits, training, and career development programs, as well as capacity-building and market access. Prior to receiving Nomi’s technical assistance and the initial order of bags, the local social enterprise had been planning to shut down due to insufficient product demand coupled with the downturn in the garment manufacturing industry. That would have resulted in 23 women losing their jobs. Our initial order allowed them to keep their doors open and women employed. By 2011, as a result of increased demand for bags created by Nomi's marketing efforts, our partner was able to increase the number of employed survivors to 80 and in 2012, Nomi was able to help the social enterprise secure an order from Walmart, one of the largest global retailers.
Diamond Ikat Bifold Wallet in Grey.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Diamond Ikat Bifold Wallet in Grey

Rula’s Letter Toiletry Bag.productDescription: 100% of sales donated to Art of Hope, a 501c3 non-profit organization that works to alleviate the trauma, PTSD, and psychological wounds among the refugee population through art-therapy, vocational training, and creative measures. Art of Hope employs local talent to engage, teach, and help heal some of the invisible wounds among Syrian refugees who forcefully fled their homes. The organization was founded by international journalist, Tara Kangarlou, who decided to move beyond just reporting on this crisis and address one of the least talked about and most damaging impacts of this war.

Rose Zalabia flats.productDescription: Darzah is a collection of fair trade, Palestinian "tatreez" embroidered products, hand-stitched by talented women artists in the West Bank. Our mission is to create economic opportunities for refugee and low-income communities and to connect women around the world through the story of tatreez embroidery. Darzah is an initiative of Child's Cup Full, a non-profit social enterprise based in the West Bank. All of the leather in our products is sourced from a family-run leather manufacturer in Khalil/Hebron. Our artisans in the Jenin region collaborate with highly skilled shoe and bag makers in Khalil/Hebron to create beautiful, one-of-a-kind products that are 100% made in Palestine. Each purchase with Darzah supports our training and employment programs in the West Bank.

Envelope Wallet in Camel.productDescription: In 2009, Nomi began working with a local social enterprise and training center in Phnom Penh whose mission is to provide vocational training and transitional jobs for survivors and women at risk of sex trafficking. Through our partnership, Nomi designed and developed a product line that is made by survivors, which Nomi markets globally. The women receive competitive wages and medical care. All proceeds from Nomi’s product sales are invested in improving benefits, training, and career development programs, as well as capacity building and market access. Prior to receiving Nomi’s technical assistance and initial order of bags, the local social enterprise had been planning to shut down due to insufficient product demand coupled with the downturn in the garment manufacturing industry. That would have resulted in 23 women losing their jobs. Our initial order allowed them to keep their doors open and women employed. By 2011, as a result of increased demand for bags created by Nomi's marketing efforts, our partner was able to increase the number of employed survivors to 80 and in 2012, Nomi was able to help the social enterprise secure an order from Walmart, one of the largest global retailers.
Envelope Wallet in Camel.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Envelope Wallet in Camel

Makeup Bag.productDescription: Threads of Hope Hellas is a non-profit civil partnership in Athens, Greece that is building pathways out of sexual slavery. Through mentoring and training, women (human trafficking victims and women at risk) learn life skills and sewing. Makeup Bag.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Makeup Bag

Blue Ikat Toiletry Case.productDescription:
Haiti Design Co-op was founded in 2014 with the goal to bring about sustainable development through design, training, and job creation. Their mantra around the workshop is "MEN ANPIL, CHAY PA LOU". This is an old Haitian proverb meaning "MANY HANDS MAKE THE LOAD LIGHT". At Haiti Design Co-op they believe that there is commonality between the designer, maker, and consumer, and that when working together we all can help lighten each other's load and bring about lasting positive impact. 

At Haiti Design Co-op they work to provide consistent employment in-house in order to give job training and stability to individuals in vulnerable situations, as well as raise up artisan leaders to succeed as independent entrepreneurs in the community.

Pumpkin Cozy Wrap.productDescription: Sewing New Futures presents our Winter Collection that will keep you warm and fashionable. Our Pumpkin Cozy Wrap is handcrafted with Ikat fabric and sewn together by our artisans with intricate embellishments. Our women workers represent ‘backwards caste’ communities that have traditionally engaged in prostitution. Starting from around 14 years old, adolescent girls are married off and forcibly engaged in prostitution by their in-laws. Sewing New Futures is an alternative livelihood generation scheme so poor adolescent girls and women can break this vicious cycle of intergenerational prostitution. 100% of the profits directly help break the cycle of intergenerational prostitution.

Purple Banana Fiber Clutch.productDescription:
Circle of Hands Uganda believes in the importance of global partnerships for the benefit of marginalized people. Since 2010 we’ve partnered with a Ugandan initiative, the Namugongo Good Samaritan Project, to support their services to Ugandan women, affected by HIV/AIDS, including: health education, counseling, business and trade skill training. 

Our mission is to empower women affected by Africa’s HIV/AIDS crisis as they become entrepreneurs, role models and leaders in their communities.

We are these ladies’ sole U.S. representative of their handcrafted, sustainable products and are proud members of the Fair Trade Federation. 

Through your purchase YOU become a vital part in the transformation and success of 200+ women in Uganda.  

*Due to the handmade nature of our products, slight variations will occur.

Sahra alzzuhur wristlet.productDescription: Darzah is a collection of fair trade, Palestinian "tatreez" embroidered products, hand-stitched by talented women artists in the West Bank. Our mission is to create economic opportunities for refugee and low-income communities and to connect women around the world through the story of tatreez embroidery. Darzah is an initiative of Child's Cup Full, a non-profit social enterprise based in the West Bank. All of the leather in our products is sourced from a family-run leather manufacturer in Khalil/Hebron. Our artisans in the Jenin region collaborate with highly skilled shoe and bag makers in Khalil/Hebron to create beautiful, one-of-a-kind products that are 100% made in Palestine. Each purchase with Darzah supports our training and employment programs in the West Bank.

The Mia Clutch.productDescription:
Haiti Design Co-op was founded in 2014 with the goal to bring about sustainable development through design, training, and job creation. Their mantra around the workshop is "MEN ANPIL, CHAY PA LOU". This is an old Haitian proverb meaning "MANY HANDS MAKE THE LOAD LIGHT". At Haiti Design Co-op they believe that there is commonality between the designer, maker, and consumer, and that when working together we all can help lighten each other's load and bring about lasting positive impact. 

At Haiti Design Co-op they work to provide consistent employment in-house in order to give job training and stability to individuals in vulnerable situations, as well as raise up artisan leaders to succeed as independent entrepreneurs in the community.
The Mia Clutch.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  The Mia Clutch

The Annapurna Tote.productDescription: Each bag is beautifully handwoven with love by the women of the Women's Skill Development Organization of Nepal. The women of the organization come from all walks of life whether it be estranged from their families, handicapped or abused. Having been in operation since 1975, they have changed forever the lives of thousands of women. A non-profit, and founder of Fair Trade Group Nepal, each bag not only supports these women but shopping consciously as a whole.

Green Purple Olok Paper Bead Necklace.productDescription:
Circle of Hands Uganda believes in the importance of global partnerships for the benefit of marginalized people. Since 2010 we’ve partnered with a Ugandan initiative, the Namugongo Good Samaritan Project, to support their services to Ugandan women, affected by HIV/AIDS, including: health education, counseling, business and trade skill training. 

Our mission is to empower women affected by Africa’s HIV/AIDS crisis as they become entrepreneurs, role models and leaders in their communities.

We are these ladies’ sole U.S. representative of their handcrafted, sustainable products and are proud members of the Fair Trade Federation. 

Through your purchase YOU become a vital part in the transformation and success of 200+ women in Uganda.

Green Layn Cuff Tino Paper Bead Bracelet.productName: Green Layn Cuff Tino Paper Bead Bracelet
Green Layn Cuff Tino Paper Bead Bracelet.productDescription:
This item was designed by Safina Nakanwagi who has said: "My beads are an expression of myself. They are beautiful and durable. I carefully select different colors and focus on designing in a special and unique way.” Safina has unknowingly described herself.

Safina joyful spirit and infectious smile disguise her painful past. She is a 40 year old, uneducated HIV-positive widow. Married at sixteen to an abusive man, she struggled to create a peaceful home for her 7 children. “The most devastating period of my life happened when he passed away of AIDS and his family accused me of his death. They evicted me.”

Since joining our partner initiative, The Namugongo Good Samaritan Project (NGSP*) Safina's outlook has changed dramatically. 100% dedicated to bead-making, she wants you to know from her heart:
“I love you very much. I reach out to say thank you for buying.”

Look good, do good with this recycled, handmade bracelet in a variety of rich colors. Learn how buying a bead empowers African women. Buy with heart today.
Green Layn Cuff Tino Paper Bead Bracelet.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Green Layn Cuff Tino Paper Bead Bracelet

Red Matino Paper Bead Bracelet.productDescription:
Circle of Hands Uganda believes in the importance of global partnerships for the benefit of marginalized people. Since 2010 we’ve partnered with a Ugandan initiative, the Namugongo Good Samaritan Project, to support their services to Ugandan women, affected by HIV/AIDS, including: health education, counseling, business and trade skill training. 

Our mission is to empower women affected by Africa’s HIV/AIDS crisis as they become entrepreneurs, role models and leaders in their communities.

We are these ladies’ sole U.S. representative of their handcrafted, sustainable products and are proud members of the Fair Trade Federation. 

Through your purchase YOU become a vital part in the transformation and success of 200+ women in Uganda.  

*Due to the handmade nature of our products, slight variations will occur.
Red Matino Paper Bead Bracelet.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Red Matino Paper Bead Bracelet

Maasai Paper Bead Necklace (Five Strand.productName: Maasai Paper Bead Necklace (Five Strand Multicolor)
Maasai Paper Bead Necklace (Five Strand.productDescription:
Ornaments4Orphans is a fair trade enterprise celebrating dignity and generosity. Our mission is to combat the global orphan crisis by providing dignified employment in impoverished areas. Most East African children are orphaned due to the effects of poverty. O4O artisans are paid well for their work, enabling them to provide for their families and preventing their children from becoming orphans. 

In addition to protecting families through employment, Ornaments4Orphans donates 100% of our profits to charitable causes serving vulnerable children in the regions where we work.
Maasai Paper Bead Necklace (Five Strand.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Maasai Paper Bead Necklace (Five Strand Multicolor)

Double Wrap Journal.productDescription:
At Elevate, we raise people up to a higher position by giving opportunities that lead to holistic empowerment. Through our handcrafted leather goods, we are able to create opportunities with our artisans so they can provide for themselves and their families. The arrow in our logo is symbolic of our purpose: to lift people up to a high position. Our hope is that you proudly wear/use your ELEVATE products knowing that you did your part to lift up the life of someone in need.
 
We not only help artisans to create financial sustainability for their families, but also mentor them to become leaders and visionaries in their communities. They are now dreaming to help more people in and outside of their city to continue the movement!

“We love empowering people to become the people who will empower others!”  -Co-Founder, Jessica Hotz
Double Wrap Journal.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Double Wrap Journal

Sitti is a social enterprise that provides fair-wage employment opportunities to women refugees in the Middle East. Handmade Wooden Soap Dish.productDescription: Sitti Soap dishes are made by Hassan, a carpenter in the Jerash Camp Rehabilitation Center's woodworking shop, where he cuts, sands and finishes each of our Wooden Soap Dishes. Water Lily 8 oz Retreat Tin Soy Candle.productDescription:
Every candle at Bright Endeavors is about creating powerful moments. These are the moments when everything changes for a young mom. They awaken her self-worth, dreams, potential, and goals. They are the instant a young mom realizes that she has the power to write her story and open doors for her child. And no one can stop her.

At Bright Endeavors, this moment is a young mom depositing her first paycheck; it is her growing confidence making a premium candle; it is her satisfaction after a hard day’s work; it is her beaming smile holding her first certificate; it is passing her GED; it is earning a job offer; it is gaining acceptance into college; it is securing quality childcare; it is providing a safe home for her children.

By investing in young moms with Bright Endeavors, you can touch the lives of two generations at once: the emerging life of a young mom and the unwritten story of her child. 

We invite you to light a candle and transform a life with us to make these moments possible.

They are the instant a young mom realizes that she has the power to write her story and open doors for her child. And no one can stop her.

At Bright Endeavors, this moment is a young mom depositing her first paycheck; it is her growing confidence making a premium candle; it is her satisfaction after a hard day’s work; it is her beaming smile holding her first certificate; it is passing her GED; it is earning a job offer; it is gaining acceptance into college; it is securing quality childcare; it is providing a safe home for her children.

By investing in young moms with Bright Endeavors, you can touch the lives of two generations at once: the emerging life of a young mom and the unwritten story of her child. 

We invite you to light a candle and transform a life with us to make these moments possible.

Safina Banana Fiber Basket - small.productDescription:
This item is created by Safina Nakanwagi whose joyful spirit and infectious smile disguise her painful past. She is a 40 year old, uneducated HIV-positive widow. Married at sixteen to an abusive man, she struggled to create a peaceful home for her 7 children. “The most devastating period of my life happened when he passed away of AIDS and his family accused me of his death. They evicted me.”

Since joining our partner initiative, the Namugongo Good Samaritan Project, Safina's outlook has changed dramatically. 100% dedicated to bead and basket-weaving, she wants you to know from her heart:
“I love you very much. I reach out to say thank you for buying.”

PICTURES: 1. Safina taking a break from rolling her beads to laugh with Circle of Hands' founder Linda 2. Cooking at the communal oven which is very smoky and hot--not a healthful way to cook. The yellow cans you see are used to collect well-water a mile away traveled by foot. Since there is no running water for showers or baths, a Ugandan living in poverty sponge bathes standing in a plastic pan like the purple one in the photo. 3. Safina's "house" is the 10'x10' room behind the doorway on the right.
Safina Banana Fiber Basket - small.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Safina Banana Fiber Basket - small

Circle of Hands Uganda believes in the importance of global partnerships for the benefit of marginalized people. Since 2010 we’ve partnered with a Ugandan initiative, the Namugongo Good Samaritan Project, to support their services to Ugandan women, affected by HIV/AIDS, including: health education, counseling, business and trade skill training. 

Our mission is to empower women affected by Africa’s HIV/AIDS crisis as they become entrepreneurs, role models and leaders in their communities.

We are these ladies’ sole U.S. representative of their handcrafted, sustainable products and are proud members of the Fair Trade Federation. 

Through your purchase YOU become a vital part in the transformation and success of 200+ women in Uganda.  

*Due to the handmade nature of our products, slight variations will occur.
Brown Black Pencil Cup Recycled Paper Ba.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Brown Black Pencil Cup Recycled Paper Bags

Quiet activity book.productDescription:
Child's Cup Full is a non-profit social enterprise with a mission to create lasting economic opportunities for refugee and low-income communities in the West Bank. At our artisan center, we train and employ talented women artisans to make beautifully handcrafted educational children's toys and other handmade products for the global marketplace. 

Right now, we have six women who work at our artisan center full-time, and many women who work with us part-time out of their homes. In 2016, we aim to grow our capacity in Zababdeh, and to build a consortium of artisan groups in Ramallah, Hebron and Bethlehem. Our goal is to employ 30 women by the end of the year. We believe that with access to business opportunities, refugee and marginalized communities can thrive.

Handfelted Small Sheep - White.productDescription:
MULXIPLY partners with fair trade artisan groups through-out the Kathmandu valley. Carefully vetted, our felting partners focus on creating job opportunities to urban and rural women seeking to lift themselves and their families out of a life of poverty.

Felt is the oldest known textile in the world. Extremely durable and water-resistant, it was once used for clothing and shelter. Nepal boasts some of the finest felt artisans in the world.

Handfelted Fox.productDescription:
Madhav Pandey finished his Masters in Public Health in Nepal and could not find a job. Instead of leaving the country, he decided to invest in his village. He started Colours Handicraft together with his wife to employ the women in his village. He runs the factory and she runs a little shop they have in the tourist section of Kathmandu. 

Felt is the oldest known textile in the world. Extremely durable and water-resistant, it was once used for clothing and shelter. Nepal boasts some of the finest felt artisans in the world. We love partnering with Colours -- their energy is contagious and their commitment to local employment, particularly at-risk women is a model MULXIPLY's mission aligns with.
Handfelted Fox.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Handfelted Fox

FOR KIDS: 2 MUKONDI’S / PINK, PURPLE, OR.productName: FOR KIDS: 2 MUKONDI’S / PINK, PURPLE, ORANGE OR TURQUOISE
FOR KIDS: 2 MUKONDI’S / PINK, PURPLE, OR.productDescription:
Dutch design made with love in Uganda!
Our 22STARS designers are talented Acholi women who survived the war in Northern Uganda. With every purchase you make an impact on their lives and help them getting a better future for their families. Our jewelry is thoughtfully handcrafted from 100% recycled paper and varnished with natural products. This makes each piece unique, lightweight, and waterproof. Animal, fruit and vegetable blocks.productDescription:
Child's Cup Full is a non-profit social enterprise with a mission to create lasting economic opportunities for refugee and low-income communities in the West Bank. At our artisan center, we train and employ talented women artisans to make beautifully handcrafted educational children's toys and other handmade products for the global marketplace. 

Right now, we have six women who work at our artisan center full-time, and many women who work with us part-time out of their homes. In 2016, we aim to grow our capacity in Zababdeh, and to build a consortium of artisan groups in Ramallah, Hebron and Bethlehem. Our goal is to employ 30 women by the end of the year. We believe that with access to business opportunities, refugee and marginalized communities can thrive.

Neel Bow Tie + Pocket Square.productDescription: Our women workers represent ‘backwards caste’ communities that have traditionally engaged in prostitution. Starting from around 14 years old, adolescent girls are married off and forcibly engaged in prostitution by their in-laws. Every purchase of an SNF product provides an artisan with a full-time job, health care benefits, day care for their children, paid vocational training, and educational workshops. 100% of the profits directly help break the cycle of intergenerational prostitution.

Diamond Ikat Tie in Grey.productDescription: In 2009, Nomi began working with a local social enterprise and training center in Phnom Penh whose mission is to provide vocational training and transitional jobs for survivors and women at risk of sex trafficking. Through our partnership, Nomi designed and developed a product line that is made by survivors, which Nomi markets globally. The women receive competitive wages and medical care. All proceeds from Nomi’s product sales are invested in improving benefits, training, and career development programs, as well as capacity-building and market access. Prior to receiving Nomi’s technical assistance and the initial order of bags, the local social enterprise had been planning to shut down due to insufficient product demand coupled with the downturn in the garment manufacturing industry. That would have resulted in 23 women losing their jobs. Our initial order allowed them to keep their doors open and women employed. By 2011, as a result of increased demand for bags created by Nomi's marketing efforts, our partner was able to increase the number of employed survivors to 80 and in 2012, Nomi was able to help the social enterprise secure an order from Walmart, one of the largest global retailers.
Diamond Ikat Tie in Grey.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  Diamond Ikat Tie in Grey

Gunmetal Grey Skinny Tie.productDescription:
Lion’s Thread partners with 7 talented women artisans in Iganga, Uganda to handcraft bow ties and neck ties out of African textiles, which are then sold in Western markets. Proceeds generated go to support programs for the individuals on our team, with the goal of empowering these women who strive to be fiscally independent, socially responsible and creatively bold to generate change themselves. 

Additionally, the women developed a program where Lion’s Thread artisans sell bow ties to tourist markets in Uganda, pooling all profits earned into a community endowment, which they utilize for school fees and emergency medical expenses. It has since evolved into a social incubator, seeking to raise enough seed capital to launch a local venture, creating lasting change in Iganga.

The Ol’ Faithful Belt - Size 40 inch.productName: The Ol’ Faithful Belt - Size 40 inch
The Ol’ Faithful Belt - Size 40 inch.productDescription:
The Loyal Workshop was founded to provide an opportunity for freedom. Modern day slavery is a phenomenon that we are not prepared to be apathetic about. We believe that another world is possible; a world where sex slavery is relegated to the history books. It’s a brazen dream but we’re putting it into action in one city, in one red-light community, with one woman at a time. We believe that business can be a tool to bring freedom to those trapped in slavery. Our business IS about freedom. Every product we create is part of a woman’s freedom journey. Thanks for your support.
Our Place: We are smack-dab in the middle of bustling Kolkata, in an area called Bowbazar. Our workshop is perched on the edge of the second largest red-light area in Kolkata, where an estimated 1500-2000 women are still trapped in the sex trade. 
Our People:Our artisans: are women from backgrounds of poverty, each with their own story of trauma and oppression: sold, stolen, trafficked and forced against their will into the sex trade. Without prospect of finding alternative employment, they were trapped. But still with dreams, talents and larger than life personalities. (You can read about each personality on ‘Meet the Artisans’)
The Ol’ Faithful Belt - Size 40 inch.pageTitle: TO THE MARKET | Survivor Made Goods -  The Ol’ Faithful Belt - Size 40 inch

Men's Belt X-Large - Eco Black.productDescription:
At Elevate, we raise people up to a higher position by giving opportunities that lead to holistic empowerment. Through our handcrafted leather goods, we are able to create opportunities with our artisans so they can provide for themselves and their families. The arrow in our logo is symbolic of our purpose: to lift people up to a high position. Our hope is that you proudly wear/use your ELEVATE products knowing that you did your part to lift up the life of someone in need.
 
We not only help artisans to create financial sustainability for their families, but also mentor them to become leaders and visionaries in their communities. They are now dreaming to help more people in and outside of their city to continue the movement!

“We love empowering people to become the people who will empower others!”  -Co-Founder, Jessica Hotz

Dusty Blue Skinny Tie with White Polka D.productName: Dusty Blue Skinny Tie with White Polka Dots
Dusty Blue Skinny Tie with White Polka D.productDescription:
Lion’s Thread partners with 7 talented women artisans in Iganga, Uganda to handcraft bow ties and neck ties out of African textiles, which are then sold in Western markets. Proceeds generated go to support programs for the individuals on our team, with the goal of empowering these women who strive to be fiscally independent, socially responsible and creatively bold to generate change themselves. 

Additionally, the women developed a program where Lion’s Thread artisans sell bow ties to tourist markets in Uganda, pooling all profits earned into a community endowment, which they utilize for school fees and emergency medical expenses. It has since evolved into a social incubator, seeking to raise enough seed capital to launch a local venture, creating lasting change in Iganga.

FOR HIM: ISHAQ MEN BRACELET SET - availa.productName: FOR HIM: ISHAQ MEN BRACELET SET - available in 4 colours
FOR HIM: ISHAQ MEN BRACELET SET - availa.productDescription:
Dutch design made with love in Uganda!
Our 22STARS designers are talented Acholi women who survived the war in Northern Uganda. With every purchase you make an impact on their lives and help them getting a better future for their families. Our jewelry is thoughtfully handcrafted from 100% recycled paper and varnished with natural products. This makes each piece unique, lightweight, and waterproof. The paper beads are not painted, but become the colour of the paper used: therefore colour shadings, sizes and patterns can vary a bit from the picture shown.The story behind your jewelry does matter: read more about us on our website. Love. Share. Support.

Zahri summer d'orsay.productDescription: Darzah is a collection of fair trade, Palestinian "tatreez" embroidered products, hand-stitched by talented women artists in the West Bank. Our mission is to create economic opportunities for refugee and low-income communities and to connect women around the world through the story of tatreez embroidery. Darzah is an initiative of Child's Cup Full, a non-profit social enterprise based in the West Bank. All of the leather in our products is sourced from a family-run leather manufacturer in Khalil/Hebron. Our artisans in the Jenin region collaborate with highly skilled shoe and bag makers in Khalil/Hebron to create beautiful, one-of-a-kind products that are 100% made in Palestine. Each purchase with Darzah supports our training and employment programs in the West Bank.

Amani Sandal.productDescription:
While doing research in the craft markets of East Africa in the summer of 2014, Caleigh Hernandez came across beautifully beaded leather sandals for sale. Struck by their uniqueness and marketability, she began searching for the source. After sever weeks of searching, she came across a Kenyan entrepreneur who owns a workshop in Kenya where these sandals are made. Caleigh traveled to her shop and introduced herself, sharing her idea of importing these sandals into the United States. Her thought was that the part of the money made from selling these shoes should be used to do social good for the local artisans making these sandals and to help combat the high rate of unemployment. Caleigh brought Lydia onboard as her primary supplier and Best Foot Forward (BFF) was launched in May 2015.

BFF footwear is a carefully chosen selection of handcrafted beaded, authentic leather sandals made by 36 women and six men artisans in coastal Kenya. Each pair of BFF sandals is a piece of art handcrafted by experienced artisans using the most basic tools and materials are sources within the African continent whenever possible. BFF combines owning a beautiful and handcrafted pair of shoes with the ability to make real and meaningful social change.
